purpleculture_pinyin:
là
12th lunar month; preserved (meat, fish etc)
12-й лунный месяц; консервы (мясо, рыба и т. д.)
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 腊)
Pictophonetic: 巤 indicates the sound; ⺼ (meat) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
臘月 [ là yuè ]: twelfth lunar month
臘腸 [ là cháng ]: sausage
臘八粥 [ là bā zhōu ]: Laba congee, ceremonial rice porridge dish eaten on the 8th day of the 12th month in the Chinese calendar

heisig_chinese_memo: If you remove the mouse hairs the flesh is decent dried meat you can cook and eat if necessary.
Ru_trainchinese:
là: (графема) копченое или вяленое мясо, вяленая рыба (приготавливается в 12м месяце по лунному календарю)
là: (графема) конец лунного года (не используется в одиночку)
xī: (графема) (книжн.) сушить мясо
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the mane (巤) of the meat (⺼) is the dried meat
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Dried meat is the way animal flesh was consumed in times past.  Now we have BBQ!
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The characters of the Warring States Period start from " flesh " and "巤" sound. The original meaning is wax sacrifice. "Shuowen": "La, after the winter solstice, at Sanxu, La sacrifices to the gods. From the flesh, the sound is loud." Duan Yucai's note: "The name of the Laben sacrifice is called the first lunar month and the first ear."

Ma Xulun believes " wax " in the original meaning of bacon, " Prince " is the winter marinated meat, bacon winter because the ancients to the ritual, the " Prince " also used the name for the festival. "The twelfth lunar month" refers to the month of the ceremonial offering, referring to the December of the lunar calendar.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as " thighs ", that is, the two arms. "Wangshan Chujian" slip 37: "(Chest) La (xian) disease" refers to diseases on the chest and both arms. " La " in Han silk script is pronounced " hunting ", referring to hunting, "Mawangdui. "Lao Zi Jiaben" line 110: "The five colors make people see (blind), while galloping in Tian La (hunting) makes people crazy.

The handed down document " La " is used as the original meaning, referring to the name of the sacrifice, "Zuo Zhuan. "The Five Years of Xi Gong": "The wonder of the palace is based on its family, saying: "Yu Bu La Ye."" Du pre-note: "The name of the gods at the end of the year." Because the La Festival is held at the end of the year, the " La " is also The extension refers to the December of the lunar calendar. "Historical Records. "Chen She Family": "The twelfth lunar month, the Chen King's Ruyin." Pei Qi's collection of quotations from Zong's "Jing Chu Ji": "The La Festival is in December, so it is called the twelfth lunar month." The meat is also called " lax ". Modern Chinese still called some kind of marinated meat is " wax ", such as "bacon", "sausage" and so on.

In ancient times, dried meat was called " La ", and the sound was the same as " Xi ". The later generations also called the winter-cured meat called "bacon", so some people used " la " as the simplified form of " la ", and the simplified character also adopted this simplified form (Ciu Xigui).
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The characters of the Warring States Period start with the sound of " flesh " and "巤". The original meaning is the name of La sacrifice. "The twelfth lunar month" is the December of the lunar calendar.
humanum_full_description:
戰國文字從「肉」，「巤」聲。本義為臘祭。《說文》：「臘，冬至後三戌，臘祭百神。从肉，巤聲。」段玉裁注：「臘本祭名，因呼臘月、臘日耳。」

　　馬敍倫則認為「臘」的本義是臘肉，「臘」是冬季醃制的肉類，因為古人冬天用臘肉來祭神，所以「臘」又用為祭名。「臘月」即臘祭的月份，指農曆十二月。

　　戰國竹簡用作「脅」，即兩膀，《望山楚簡》簡37：「𦙞(胸)臘(脅)病」，指胸口與兩膀處有疾病。漢帛書「臘」讀作「獵」，指狩獵，《馬王堆．老子甲本》第110行：「五色使人目明〈盲〉，馳騁田臘(獵)使人心發狂。」

　　傳世文獻「臘」有用作本義，指祭名，《左傳．僖公五年》：「宮之奇以其族行，曰：『虞不臘也。』」杜預注：「歲終祭眾神之名。」因臘祭在年末舉行，因此「臘」又引申指農曆十二月。《史記．陳涉世家》：「臘月，陳王之汝陰。」裴駰集解引宗懍《荊楚記》：「臘節在十二月，故因是謂之臘月也。」由此加以引申，冬季醃制的肉類也稱為「臘」。現代漢語仍稱某種醃制的肉類為「臘」，如「臘肉」、「臘腸」等。

　　由於古代把乾肉稱為「腊」，音同「昔」。後代又稱冬季醃制的肉類稱為「臘肉」，於是有人把「腊」當作「臘」的簡體使用，簡化字也採用了這個簡體(裘錫圭)。
humanum_short_description: 戰國文字從「肉」，「巤」聲。本義為臘祭名。「臘月」即農曆十二月。
_purpleculture_dictionary_orig_full:
臘 (Simplified: 腊)
Pinyin: là
English Definition: 12th lunar month; preserved (meat, fish etc)
Total strokes: 19; Radical: 肉
Pictophonetic: 巤 indicates the sound; ⺼ (meat) conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • ⺼ meat, flesh; organic compound
    • 巤 [ liè ] a mouse's whiskers; a horse's mane; a fish's dorsal fin
Example Words:
臘月 [ là yuè ]: twelfth lunar month
臘腸 [ là cháng ]: sausage
臘八粥 [ là bā zhōu ]: Laba congee, ceremonial rice porridge dish eaten on the 8th day of the 12th month in the Chinese calendar

戰國文字從「 肉 」，「 巤 」聲。本義為臘祭。《說文》：「臘，冬至後三戌，臘祭百神。从肉，巤聲。」段玉裁注：「臘本祭名，因呼臘月、臘日耳。」 馬敍倫則認為「 臘 」的本義是臘肉，「 臘 」是冬季醃制的肉類，因為古人冬天用臘肉來祭神，所以「 臘 」又用為祭名。「臘月」即臘祭的月份，指農曆十二月。 戰國竹簡用作「 脅 」，即兩膀，《望山楚簡》簡37：「𦙞(胸)臘(脅)病」，指胸口與兩膀處有疾病。漢帛書「 臘 」讀作「 獵 」，指狩獵，《馬王堆．老子甲本》第110行：「五色使人目明〈盲〉，馳騁田臘(獵)使人心發狂。」 傳世文獻「 臘 」有用作本義，指祭名，《左傳．僖公五年》：「宮之奇以其族行，曰：『虞不臘也。』」杜預注：「歲終祭眾神之名。」因臘祭在年末舉行，因此「 臘 」又引申指農曆十二月。《史記．陳涉世家》：「臘月，陳王之汝陰。」裴駰集解引宗懍《荊楚記》：「臘節在十二月，故因是謂之臘月也。」由此加以引申，冬季醃制的肉類也稱為「 臘 」。現代漢語仍稱某種醃制的肉類為「 臘 」，如「臘肉」、「臘腸」等。 由於古代把乾肉稱為「 腊 」，音同「 昔 」。後代又稱冬季醃制的肉類稱為「臘肉」，於是有人把「 腊 」當作「 臘 」的簡體使用，簡化字也採用了這個簡體(裘錫圭)。

臘字的基本解释

臘
là
见“腊2”。

臘字的汉语字典释义

[①]［là］
［《廣韻》盧盍切，入盍，來。］
亦作“臈1”。
(1)祭名。古代称祭百神为“蜡”，祭祖先为“臘”；秦汉以后统称“臘”。
(2)岁末。因腊祭而得名，通指农历十二月或泛指冬月，常与“伏”相对。
(3)佛教戒律规定比丘受戒后每年夏季三个月安居一处，修习教义，称一腊。亦特指僧侣受戒后的岁数或泛指年龄。
(4)冬天腌制鱼肉鸡鸭等的通称。
(5)姓。
[②]［liè］
［《集韻》力涉切，入葉，來。］
剑的两面刃。

臘字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【肉字部】　臘； 康熙笔画：21； 页码：页997第30
【廣韻】盧盍切【集韻】【韻會】力合切【正韻】落合切，?音蠟。【說文】冬至後三戌，臘祭百神也。【禮·月令】孟冬臘先祖五祀。【註】此周禮所謂蜡祭也。【前漢·武帝紀】祠門戸比臘。【註】臘者，冬至後臘祭百神也。又【陳勝傳】臘月，勝之汝隂。【註】張晏曰：秦之臘月，夏之九月。臣瓚曰：建丑之月也。又【正字通】風俗通：蔡邕獨斷，皆言夏曰淸祀，殷曰嘉平，周曰蜡，漢曰臘。一說月令，孟冬臘先祖五祀，自昔有之，非自漢始也。又鄭?月令註：臘卽周禮所謂蜡。不知臘祭先祖，蜡祭百神，二祭各別，鄭合爲一，非。又晉博士張亮議曰：臘者，接也，祭宜在新故交接也。俗謂臘之明日爲初歲，秦漢以來有賀，此皆古之遺俗也。又道書言，道家有五臘，正月一日爲天臘，五月五日爲地臘，七月七日爲道德臘，又以十月十二日爲民歲臘，十二月正臘日爲王侯臘。　又【博雅】臘，索也。　又刃也。【周禮·冬官考工記】桃氏爲劒，臘廣二寸有半寸。【註】臘，謂兩刃。【疏】兩刃者，兩面各有刃也。　又【正字通】眞臘，南蠻國名。　又【集

暂无。

Wax
Basic explanation of words
Wax
là
See "La 2".
Wax
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［là］
["Guangyun" Lu Qi cuts, enters, come. ]
Also known as "臈1".
(1) The name of the sacrifice. In ancient times, worshipping a hundred gods was called "wax" and worshiping ancestors was called "la"; after Qin and Han dynasties, it was collectively called "la".
(2) The end of the year. It is named after the La Festival, which refers to the December of the lunar calendar or generally refers to the winter moon, and is often opposite to "fu".
(3) The Buddhist precepts stipulate that monks live in one place for three months each summer after taking the precepts, and practice the teachings, which is called Yila. It also refers specifically to the age of a monk after taking the ordination or generally refers to age.
(4) General term for marinated fish, meat, chicken, duck, etc. in winter.
(5) Last name.
[②]［liè］
["Jiyun" cuts, enters the leaves, come. ]
The two sides of the sword.
Wax
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not set next] [Department of meat characters] 　La; Kangxi strokes: 21; Page number: page 997 30
[Guang Yun] Lu Qiqie [Jiyun] [Rhyme Hui] forceful cut [Zheng Yun] Ochiai cut, sound wax. [Said the text] After the winter solstice, there is a sacrifice to the hundred gods in the Sanxu period. 【Rite·Yueling】Five Sacrifices of the Ancestor of Meng Dongla [Note] This week's ceremony is also called wax sacrifice. [Previous Han·Wu Emperor Ji] Shrine gate Birla. [Note] La people, after the winter solstice, La sacrifices to hundreds of gods. Also【Chen Sheng Chuan】The twelfth lunar month, the victory of Ruyin. [Note] Zhang Yan said: Qin’s twelfth lunar month, Xia’s September. Chen Zan said: The month of Jian Chou. Also [Zhengzitong] Customs are common: Cai Yong is arbitrarily saying that Xia is called Songsi, Yin is called Jiaping, Zhou is called wax, and Han is called wax. In terms of Yueling, the five ancestors of Meng Dongla's ancestors have existed since the past, not since the Han Dynasty. Also Zheng? Yueling's Note: The so-called wax in Layu Zhouli. I don’t know that the wax sacrifices to the ancestors, the wax sacrifices to the hundred gods, the two sacrifices are separate, and the Zheng is one. Dr. Zhang Liang of Youjin said: "For those who are waxy, take it, and the sacrifice should be handed over in the new old." It is said that tomorrow is the first year of La, and there have been congratulations since the Qin and Han dynasties. This is also a legacy of the ancients. It is also said in Taoist scriptures that Taoism has Wula, the first month is Tianla, May 5 is Dila, July 7 is Moral La, and October 12 is Minsu La, and December is Zheng La. The day is Wang Hula.　[Bo Ya] La, Suo Ye.　It's also a blade. [Zhou Li·Dongguan Kao Gong Ji] Tao Shi is 劒, and La Guang is half an inch in two inches. [Note] La is called two-edged. 【Sparse】Two-edged people have two blades on both sides.　[Zhengzitong] Hula, the name of Nanban country.　又【集
